Column Comment.0: SEISMIC SET SUBTYPE: The seismic set type column is used to enforce arelationship between the SEIS SET supertype and its valid sub types. Values for thiscolumn must be the name of the table that is the valid sub type for this row of data.Valid entries include SEIS_LINE, SEIS_SEGMENT, SEIS_SURVEY, SEIS_PLAN,SEIS_WELL, SEIS_PROC_SET, SEIS_INTERP_SET or SEIS_3D.
Column Comment.1: SEISMIC SET: A seismic set is a super type of various types of seismic collections.
Column Comment.2: BIN GRID ID: Primary unique identifier for Bin grid
Column Comment.3: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: ANGLE ROTATION: Angle of rotation in degrees
Column Comment.6: BIN GRID TYPE: may be surface or subsurface
Column Comment.7: BIN GRID VERSION: The version of the bin grid
Column Comment.8: BIN METHOD: the method used to create seismic bins, such as rectilinear, flexbinning with radius of 4 bins, bin borrowing etc.
Column Comment.9: BIN POINT ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the Original units of measure used foroffset measurements
Column Comment.10: ACQUISITION IDENTIFIER: Unique Identifier for the coordinate acquisition.
Column Comment.11: COORDINATE SYSTEM ID: unique identifier for the coordinate system.
Column Comment.12: CORNER LATITUDE: The latitude of one of three corners of the bin grid that can beused to calculate the bin grid, rather than storing the point locations explicitly.
Column Comment.13: CORNER LONGITUDE: The longitude of one of three corners of the bin grid that canbe used to calculate the bin grid, rather than storing the point locations explicitly.
Column Comment.14: CORNER LATITUDE: The latitude of one of three corners of the bin grid that can beused to calculate the bin grid, rather than storing the point locations explicitly.
Column Comment.15: CORNER LONGITUDE: The longitude of one of three corners of the bin grid that canbe used to calculate the bin grid, rather than storing the point locations explicitly.
Column Comment.16: CORNER LATITUDE: The latitude of one of three corners of the bin grid that can beused to calculate the bin grid, rather than storing the point locations explicitly.
Column Comment.17: CORNER LONGITUDE: The longitude of one of three corners of the bin grid that canbe used to calculate the bin grid, rather than storing the point locations explicitly.
Column Comment.18: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.19: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.20: FOLD COVERAGE: the fold coverage that was created for this binning. In this case,coverage is created during processing, rather than during aquisition.
Column Comment.21: LOCAL COORDINATE SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the localcoordinate system, such as a local grid system (ATS, STS, MTS etc) to which thesecoordinates have been referenced. Coordinates that are referenced to a localcoordinate system are usually surveyed relative to the local system using metes andbounds or local survey references; maintaining the position of each point relative toits referenced local system is very important to survey accuracy.
Column Comment.22: NLINE AZIMUTH: The azimuth of the inline (source line) component of a 3D grid
Column Comment.23: NLINE COUNT: optional location to store the number of NLINES (source line) in theBin Grid
Column Comment.24: INLINE MAXIMUN NUMBER: The maximum inline (source line) number of the 3Dgrid. Also called source line.
Column Comment.25: INLINE MINIMUM NUMBER: The minimum inline (source line) number of the 3Dgrid. Also called source line.
Column Comment.26: INLINE SPACING: In lines are orthogonal to cross lines. Space between in lines(source line). Also called source line.
Column Comment.27: REFERENCE NORTH: A reference table identifying valid north references used insurveying to define angular measurements. For example, True North, MagneticNorth, Grid North, Astronomical North, ...
Column Comment.28: POINT OF ORIGIN EASTING: optional UTM value for point of origin
Column Comment.29: POINT OF ORIGIN LATITUDE: LATITUDE OF THE POINT OF ORIGIN OF A 3DGRI D
Column Comment.30: POINT OF ORIGIN LONGITUDE: Longitude of the point of origin of a 3D Grid
Column Comment.31: POINT OF ORIGIN NORTHING: UTM value for the point of origin
Column Comment.32: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.33: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.34: XLINE AZIMUTH: The azimuth of the cross line component (receiver) of a 3D grid.Also called receiver line.
Column Comment.35: XLINE COUNT: optional location to store the number of XLINES (receiver) in the BinGrid
Column Comment.36: XLINE MAXIMUM NUMBER: The maximum cross line number (receiver) of the 3Dgrid. Also called receiver line.
Column Comment.37: XLINE MINIMUM NUMBER: The minimum cross line number (receiver) of the 3Dgrid. Also called receiver line.
Column Comment.38: CROSS LINE SPACING: Spacing between cross lines (receiver) in a 3D grid. Alsocalled receiver line.
Column Comment.39: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.40: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.41: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.42: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.43: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.44: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.45: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
